185694984.review: My first steam Otome Visual Novel and i LOVE it very much!!<3  i had so much fun collecting every achievements and finished everything in 15 hours. The whole game is very refreshing and engaging, The GUI was clean and easy to use. I was impressed with the overall quality of this game as it is a reflection of how far the Dicesuki team has come since their first game and I am excited to see what other gems they have waiting for us in the future!

185684890.review:
As a game, I would say Cinderella Phenomenon is average, but as a novel, it's excellent.

This visual novel (VN) has a captivating story. I love the twists on classic fairy tales and the incorporation of traditional fairy tale lessons. Overall, the stories are fun, sweet, exciting, and romantic. Although the tone is a bit young for me (as is typical of many VNs), I didn't find it overly immature or cringy.

Gameplay: The biggest issue I have with the game aspect is the limited number of choices—only about three per chapter, and these are very long chapters. For the most part, the consequences of these choices feel random, with little indication of how they might affect others' reactions. In a game like this, I would prefer options to be more intuitive, either based on what you know about the story or what you can extrapolate from the characters. Unfortunately, only a small handful of choices seem to follow this approach.

Suggested Route Order: To build on the narrative and avoid spoilers about characters before completing their routes, I recommend playing in the following order:

Rod
Karma
Rumpel
Fritz
Waltz

Minor Spoilers Ahead

Route Impressions (Good Endings):

Rod:
Rod's story focuses heavily on Lucette's family and includes more Cinderella elements than the other routes. However, both Rod's personality and his connection with Lucette feel flat, with little reason for their romance to develop. His story serves as a baseline, making it a good starting point if you're planning to play all the routes.

Karma:
Karma's story is arguably the best in terms of romance. His and Lucette's personalities complement each other well, and they both grow significantly throughout the route. He also has one of the more intriguing curses.

Rumpel:
Rumpel's story is comparable to Karma's in terms of romance and character development. While I personally prefer Karma's dynamic with Lucette, Rumpel's route is still engaging and heartfelt (and in some ways a little more silly/humorous).

Fritz:
Fritz's story is the darkest but also the least compelling in terms of his personality. While Rod feels like the weakest romantic fit for Lucette, Fritz has minimal screen time and a one-dimensional "white knight" character. Varg is far more compelling in this route, but he isn't an option. Although Fritz's story is harsher and more tragic than the others, it provides crucial background information on the main conflict.

Waltz:
Waltz's route involves more reconciliation with Lucette's father than the others. Since I played his story last, it felt less exciting, likely because I had already uncovered much of the overarching narrative.  Despite this, Waltz's route ties together many elements from the other stories, making it feel like a "true" ending or golden route.

Overall Thoughts:

Karma and Rumpel's routes are more character-driven and sweet, focusing on building relationships and personal growth. In contrast, Fritz and Rod's routes are more story-driven. Waltz's route strikes a balance between the two.

Waltz and Fritz's routes are the only ones where you encounter Lucette's mother, and they also have more tragedies, particularly Fritz's (though still HEA). Additionally, Rod and Fritz's routes are set primarily within the palace, while Karma and Rumpel's take place at the Marchen. Waltz's story combines elements of both settings.

Waltz's ending ties up many of the storylines and highlights the theme of personal growth and being a good person. While this makes it feel like the most satisfying conclusion, I still believe Karma's route offers the sweetest romance, closely followed by Rumpel's.

185449687.review:
Cinderella Phenomenon has been a favorite visual novel of mine for a long time. I remember watching a youtuber do a playthrough when I was younger and was so excited to play the game myself. I definitely recommend playing the game but some things to be aware of: if you ever switch devices the game resets itself on steam even if your achievements stay, there is a relationship with Rumpel that is a large age gap, and Rod is your step-brother.

To give more context, I had gotten a new laptop in the midst of completing this game and upon opening the game on my new laptop I was distraught to discover all my saves vanished and none of the routes I completed were visible. The opening page having the picture of the guys you completed the route for and all of them had been gems, nothing having saved from the game previously. So if you want to complete this game be aware not to switch devices in the midst of it.

Regarding routes, my favorite is definitely Waltz but within the common routes my favorite is Karma. I think these two routes are so well written and I definitely enjoyed them the most so when I had to regain the progress I lost I decided to fully replay those routes. My third favorite was Fritz as the only thing that upsets me about his route is how you get a happy ending but I can't give more context without spoilers. Finally, out of the last two it goes Rumpel then Rod because of the age gap and step-brother part of their relationships it stopped me from fully enjoying their routes myself specifically Rod's route. I know it doesn't bother everyone but I would like to point it out in case it does bother you as it did bother me somewhat. But otherwise each route has been done with so much care and done well, I look forward to playing the Cinderella Phenomenon: Evermore.

184906050.review:
Spoilers Ahead! - If any 

(This is my own opinion on how I felt about each character’s route. I really liked all of them just some more than others) So, the ranking for each character is as follows – 
Waltz 
Karma (Klaude) 
Rod
Rumpel (Chevalier)
Fritz

To start this list is very different from when I first played it. Then again when I first played it was like four years ago and I had only finished Karma and Rod’s route. I finally finished all routes and that’s where my opinion changes. Karma’s route was the first one I did, and I loved his character and the storyline as Beauty and the Beast is one of my favorite Disney movies. I was going to give Karma first place; However Waltz gets first places because I liked his storyline just a tad more. Rod is kind of the middleman as I did like the storyline better than Rumple’s and Fritz. I could never really enjoy Rumple’s route. It was sweet but just not my favorite. Now Fritz’s? I wanted so much to like his route because when I played the prologue, he was the first character’s route I wanted to complete. Then I realized his route was locked. I’ve heard someone else mention this and I agree. I felt like there wasn’t as much build up to the romance as the other characters. Plus, I felt his route contained the most deaths and I really disliked Hildyr and didn’t enjoy reading about the time her and Lucette spent in the palace. Though I know it was necessary for Fritz’s route. Apart from that I really did enjoy all the love interest’s routes and for a free Otome game it really is amazing. The story kept me engage and I looked forward to every chance I got to continue the game. I hated going back through the game to get the bad endings, but I wanted to get all the achievements and it was interesting to see the bad outcomes of each man’s route. I look forward to continuing the adventure in the sequel and seeing how the mc's relationship grows with the men.

184905247.review:
Why are 2/5 love interests children? One of them even being the character's stepbrother?

The player has no agency and is still verbally berated by everyone for how horrible they are. The main character is a 17-yo (another child) who had an abusive mother, an emotionally absent father, and who is just supposed to love their new step-family while being told that everyone's problems are their fault. 

The game feels like a masochistic experience, there is no fun, only pain and victim-hood. I appreciate it being a free game and it having nice art but it's just so unpleasant to play.

184811326.review:
Es una novela gráfica linda con historia profunda de cada personaje, puede ser cansado el hecho de como se comporta la protagonista (amiga reacciona pd: no la culpo) pero lograron que cada historia sea distinta, nada repetitiva, con cada personaje por lo que no es tedioso el continuar con los demás caminos.
Sin más que añadir, buen juego, entretenido.

184281496.review:
This is my first review so I apologise in advance for any mistakes that might have been done. 

My Opinion and review:
Cinderella Phenomenon is a wonderful game and the first otome I have ever played. The characters are all very interesting and all of them have their own personality traits. They are not copypaste of each others like some other games do. Also the character developement in this game is very well made and doesn't happen immediately which is realistic. The main character, Lucette is one I really like and we can explore different aspects of her life in every routes. Uncovering the events which occured during her childhood and justify the way she acts is very interesting.

GO PLAY THIS GAME RIGHT NOW, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
IT'S FREE, PLAY IT
